title: Andrea Mitchell Escorted From State Department After Confronting Tillerson
text:
Andrea Mitchell Escorted From State Department After Confronting Tillerson "I'm so sorry, but you're going to have to leave." by Charles Campbell March 7, 2017 at 3:59pm Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print   
MSNBC’s Andrea Mitchell was booted from the State Department during a photo op after she attempted to ask Secretary of State Rex Tillerson questions about national security. 
Mitchell played a clip of the exchange on her show Tuesday afternoon. 
“That was only moments ago on the seventh floor of the State Department,” Mitchell told her audience. “Still no answers from Secretary of State Rex Tillerson.”   Former Attorney General: Trump Surveillance OK’d Through Justice Dept. [Video] 
In the video, Tillerson can be seen shaking hands with Ukrainian Foreign Minister Pavlo Klimkin and posing for photographs. 
Mitchell then asks about China’s and Russia’s relationships with Ukraine, but both diplomats refuse to give her an answer.   
“Are you sure that the Trump administration will be strong against (Russian President) Vladimir Putin? Can you assure us that Russia will not be able to move forward in Ukraine?” Mitchell asks Klimkin. 
Shortly thereafter, she’s asked by State Department staffers to leave the area. 
“We haven’t had any time in here,” Mitchell says to the staff. 
“I’m so sorry, but you’re going to have to leave,” one staffer responds.   Gowdy: Evidence So Far Lacking To Support Trump’s Wiretap Claim 
After playing a clip of the exchange, Mitchell said the State Department is “taking a back seat on national security and is now facing massive budget cuts.” 
“This afternoon I’ll be at the first State Department briefing, the first in six weeks since the inaugural,” she continued, “an absence of public diplomacy not seen since 1953 when Dwight Eisenhower was president, when this tradition started of speaking out from the platform here at the State Department to the rest of the world.” 
A similar situation required Mitchell to be escorted out of the State Department building last Friday. 
During a meeting between Tillerson and International Atomic Energy Agency Director Yukiya Amano, Mitchell asked repeatedly about potential budget cuts to the State Department. 
After not receiving an answer, Mitchell was confronted by staffers and asked to leave. What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
